comments.commentBody: The base won't get the payola from the tax cuts.  Those are for Wall Street as the swamp in lower Manhattan sluices in to Foggy Bottom.

Un pesce puzza dalla testa.
It's Italian. A fish stinks from the head.

You know I am starting to doubt that Mike Flynn lied to Pence. I mean why would Flynn be talking to Pence anyway - it looks like Trump doesn't talk to Pence so why should Flynn have felt the need to explain his actions to him?
More likely, the whole lying thing was the excuse to get Flynn out of the way and to stop questions about what he was talking about and what other contacts he might have made.
They will probably bump him off!

Because Pence, and formerly Sessions are the real political-heads in the WH. (But we cant count out Sessions as still having a consuling role.)

Hence all the confusion of the WH messaging. You have a permanently off-script Prez, a VP with more of a political network then his boss, and then a bunch of naive novices and ideologues hell-bent on destruction of Gov't lumbering around the WH looking for any means to increase their portfolios.

None of these people are truly devoted to the Prez, or his alleged agenda, and certainly not to governance, but instead its about a dozen or more agendas in small pool. Too many sharks in a small tank, and little to eat...

There is no one in that WH circle dedicated to the craft of governance.
What was Ambassador Kislyak even doing at the convention in Cleveland? He wasn't in Philadelphia even though Hilary Clinton was then favored by the polls to win the election.
Excellent question. Maybe one Jefferson B. Sessions didn't want to answer so he took the approved Trump administration method and lied in the hopes of never hearing about it again?
Going to the Rock 'n' Roll Hall of Fame?
Are you suggesting he might have known something we didn't?
@Louise. I believe a reporter did ask Kislyak about the contents of his conversations with Flynn and Sessions and he declined to disclose them.
This is just part of the Trump post election vetting process so that Sessions can make his bones and join the Liars Club.

Was the airport in Mina, Arkansas?

OK. That was frivolous. I agree with Ian Fleming. Let there be extended investigations.

Dear Amy
I am sitting here in a hotel lobby in Chiang Mai Thailand waiting for my ride to an elephant sanctuary. I clicked on your article and I am so happy I did. Reading it at first I was strucked at how your love letter reminded me of my husband whom I love dearly, but then towards the end the part of your tattoo shook me to my core. Thank you for that for reminding me how important it is to appreaciate every single day. Every breath, every sunset, every single second to take the opportunity to take in More. To live, love, and feel with passion. Thank you. I have been thinking of getting a tattoo and in your honor and in honor of living life to the fullest I will also get one of More. Thank you once again.
Hi Amy... If you haven't yet, I hope you call on Jesus Christ to take you to heaven with Him. And I hope your dear husband and children do as well, so that some day you all can be together again. :o)

I guess Ms Rosenthal is of Jewish faith. So you know her own God will take her to heaven when the time comes,  just as easily as Jesus Christ. Why you try to shove down your own faith on a family facing as a deep sad situation as this is beyond belief.
My daughter has referred to peas as "happy peas" since she could speak thanks to you. A beautiful love story.

"...want to make this administration not to execute anything as the executive branch of the government of this nation."

Sounds suspiciously like something Mitch McConnell and his Russophile henchmen said and did for the EIGHT YEARS of the Obama presidency. So please, stop with the crocodile tears and understand that the Republicans' chickens are coming home to roost in the very swamp they created. You'll get neither sympathy nor kid glove treatment from me.

So true!

My father was so utterly bereft at 58 after Mom's sudden heart attack he would sometimes pull the car over to the side of the road and just weep - shaking so much he was unable to drive. For about a year. Then he literally dove into the first willing proposal. She was a psycho and a pathological liar, and she turned him against all of us. She appeared to hate her own two young children as much as she hated my fathers three adult ones, and although thy'd fought her ex husband for custody, they were forever complaining about how these 'terrible children' were ruining their precious life together, or how me and my brothers clearly "Didn't want him to be happy again'. Eventually her biological daughter committed suicide at 15 inside their house. We found out (from the local paper) that the wife had become angry with her daughter over some trivial thing and thus the two of them, she AND my father, had deliberately not spoken to their 15 year old daughter even though they lived in the same house - for close to a year! No wonder the poor girl was at the end of her rope (Quite literally, sadly)

All this to say that yes - he panicked, and he went in too fast. For all I know, they may be happy together. But the collateral damage has been horrific.

Loved from the beginning.
Gushed at Plan "Be."
Laughed out loud at the gumball, (more of a guffaw), and
Standing O at your ability to convey Grief in the form of an Ad for your husband.
Blessings, peace, joy to you and in gratitude for you.
You are obviously beautiful!
Signed,
Oncology Social Worker

Every single day now, Amy, new treatments for cancer are being approved.  I want you to live.  I want there to be a miracle.  There ARE miracles.  Your family sounds like an exceptional miracle...you, Jason, and your boys.  The specialness of a person who could write this essay a this time is not lost on anyone who reads it.  Although I don't know you, I send you my love, my prayers, and I wish I had a magic wand to make everything bad in your life turn immediately good.  But since I don't...I am praying for a miracle for you and your family, and you will not leave my thoughts.  What a sensitive, phenomenal woman you are, with an extraordinary heart.  My love to you, Amy.

Mary, Valerie Harper was on her own path, too, and she had only weeks to live, according to what I read.  She is still with us.  Same with former president Jimmy Carter.  Both have had malignant brain cancers for a very long period of time now.  Is there something wrong with hoping and praying for something good?  I do not respect negativity, even when it seems to be warranted.  It doesn't help anyone.
And it is kind, decent, and RIGHT, to keep hoping for miracles...and that Amy should have one, and so should her family.  I will keep praying.  It sure doesn't hurt to keep hoping and praying.

And let me also say this:  TOMORROW a drug may be approved that gives Amy more life.  The new cancer treatments coming fast and furiously now, but not fast and furiously enough.  And, in fact, the drug or combination of drugs that may help Amy may already be here, but not used for her yet.  Anyone who doesn't hope and pray for miracles gives in to negativity.  AMY--DO NOT!  NEVER GIVE UP!  NEVER GIVE IN!

Perhaps, if that's what he chooses. But it is true that people who are good at marriage, find it, much more often than not.  Amy should know that her happy life and marriage with her husband is a resource to him for the rest of his life.
I think you got more in your life than most of us ever will even at the age of 90. You are a lucky women and your husband hopefully knows how lucky he is to have you. All the best for both of you!

Little Miss Planted a Kiss...
She decided to share.
"Don't you dare. It'll go bare."
From one small kiss...
Eternal bliss.

I knew you were special.
Thank you for inspiring me to become an author...for giving me your work to be tools to display life lessons in beautiful stories.
Yours is a life well-lived.
I will share your works with kiddos to help them as part of my "Posikidly" mission.
I should have had the nerve to look you up when I first thought of it. It may be too late for me to meet you, but through your work and family you will live forever.
Poetry.  So much love, both in what was said and what was left unsaid.  May you, Jason, and your children all find more.

Thank you, Amy. I was diagnosed with ALS last year, and you have given me the best idea for a farewell gift to my husband of 30 years. We made a beautiful life together, and he deserves to be loved, and to love again.
Blessings ❤

Dear Amy

God Bless You for all that you are dealing with right now. I am so sorry for your life path cut short, it is the greatest challenge of this world to face death consciously and even graciously and you dear woman are most certainly attending to yours with grace and profound caring for your Beloved Jason. I have been here on earth quite a long time now, always waiting for the time that I would meet the special person that I have always instinctively knew would arrive. When i read your message, and your beautiful sharing about Jason I had a feeling, YES! like this... a man who knows how to love, and who has lived through the greatest of life's loves and life's heartbreaks. There are not so many people, men or women who can brave such depth and breadth of life and choose to continue with an open heart. I am a spiritual counselor whose place in this world is at the veil between this world and the next. May your transition be beauty filled even as I know your human heart will ache in the pre- mature departure from this world. So much love and light await you as your journey continues in other realms. And if your beloved Jason finds himself ready to reach for more love and joy as you have shared with him I would be honored to know him, as friend, as fellow travel on the path of love and loss and as companion in what ever form. blessings of grace to you.

Jason and Amy, I hope that you are cuddling in bed and that tomorrow Jason will devise another clever smiley face out of 2-3 things nearby.  I wish you two and your children some time without intrusion right now and continued love...always. I do believe that "tears are our teachers"---and you've certainly taught many of us a lot with this piece, Amy. You share that you are concerned for Jason and want the absolute richest future for him. In sharing your wish for his happiness, you also remind us to recognize and appreciate our own spouses and the stories we've written with them. Even decades after our weddings, when we have slept together thousands of nights (with bedhead, no doubt) and constructed such unique bonds, this essay is a serious reminder to appreciate each other. Thank you for this gift. Thank you for sharing your story. May peace come to you, Jason and your children. XOXOXOXOXO

Thank you for this essay.  I hate that you are so sick, I will miss you so much. The last 9 years went by like lightning and it never occurred to me that you might not always be here. I can't imagine what it must be like to be leaving a place that you love so much and leaving the family you love, and you are excellent at loving. You have always been so very good at seeing and encouraging the miraculous in life,  I imagine when you are untethered from the limits of your human form, your energy and enthusiasm will make the sun will shine brighter and there will be more shooting stars and rainbows than ever before. Thank you.

Gail, as for what to do about or with Sessions, I offer up a gesture of compassion. Even though it is March and in Texas winter occurred on a Tuesday in early December, there are areas of the country where blizzards and icy conditions are quite possible for 3 or 4 more weeks, mainly in the vicinity of where Jeff may be standing at any given moment. He'll need some insulation, of some snug-fitting black material (to absorb what little radiant heat the sun may cast his way) with a generous layer of natural, organic insulation, humanely harvested from our friends the chickens and waterfowl. Finally, to preserve the AG's energy for the coming (please don't let it be so) 4 years, he be provided with transportation . Yon oak tree has a sturdy bearing and will surely bear its load with comfort and style.

Since this rough start has been none of his own doing, let's give him a little taste of the justice it is his sworn duty to uphold.

I am truly beginning to wonder if the liberal enclaves around this great nation are ever going to awaken and rise up out of their self-imposed state of denial. November 8, 2016 seems like so long ago but in was really only a little shy of four months.
All of the shock of Hillary's defeat should be over by now. I remember being surprised when President Obama won his first term yet put it into perspective considering how hard it is for any party to win a third consecutive term. The attention span of the masses is usually not that long before change is demanded.
But today the party on the left is in absolute anarchy. They are still in the middle of an enormous temper tantrum without an end in sight. This tantrum is beginning to boil all through this country. The level of hate and vitriol aimed at any citizen that braves to speak out against any progressive ideal is stunning. There is no middle ground to be had. If a citizen happens to believe that a decision make by the current administration is good for this country that citizen is immediately pounced upon by multiple liberals. To this new left party there is no compromise, no room for ones own thoughts and most shocking of all, no room for white citizens unless they stand atop the highest mountain of the land and declare their "white privilege," apologize for every ill in the history of America.
I hope it is not too late to avoid all out culture conflict. I really do not think they are aware of the beast they would awaken.

G.H. war was declared on liberalism perhaps not by you, but by many conservatives, a long time ago.  Every trick in the book and quite of few not written anywhere, were used to stymie our last President.  It seems childish to criticize those for fighting fire with fire.

The beast has been awake for a while now. IF you talk about lack of compromise, focus your attention on the Tea Party and their ilk, as well as the other members of the GOP who were turning far right in an effort not to be outflanked by them. They did everything, and then some, to block Obama's agenda. They now tout an infrastructure agenda as if this was some novel idea yet they blocked it when it was an idea put forth by Obama. They blocked Obama's candidate for the supreme court for a year until Trump was elected. They threatened to shut down the government.
The GOP set the example of what a scorched earth policy looks like in politics.
The democrats just need to follow their guidebook.

Utter nonsense. What a majority of citizens are “aware” of is the “beast" that has already awoken is pretending to be president. The hate and vitriol was a central theme of his campaign and what “middle ground” has ever been embraced when Obama was President? If this ”culture conflict” is to be avoided the party of denial will need to embrace the truth.
I understand...
